block.p: The San Antonio Spurs' sweep of the Cleveland Cavaliers produced the N.B.A.'s least-viewed championship, with an average of 9.2 million viewers, as measured by Nielsen Media Research. The previous low, almost 9.9 million, was in 2003 when the Spurs defeated the Nets.

Game 4 on Thursday night, won by the Spurs, 83-82, attracted 9.8 million viewers, the most for the series. But that was down 16 percent from the comparable game in the Dallas-Miami series last year. The Spurs-Cavaliers attracted less than half the highest-average viewership for the finals this decade -- the 18.9 million who tuned in to see the Los Angeles Lakers beat Philadelphia in five games in 2001.
